text: Though there might not be any easy answers to the problem of poverty, its most compelling scribes do not resign themselves to representation solely for the sake of those age-old verities of truth and beauty.
author: Leslie Jamison

text: Far from creating a new formalism, what these can yield is something far transcending surface values since they not only embody form as beauty, but also form in which intuitions or ideas or conjectures have taken visible substance.
author: Max Bill

text: Beauty: the adjustment of all parts proportionately so that one cannot add or subtract or change without impairing the harmony of the whole.
author: Leon Battista Alberti

text: Time takes the ugliness and horror out of death and turns it into beauty.
author: Dodie Smith

text: I'm not out here to win a beauty contest.
author: Kirk Gibson
